exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content:
1. **Correct the following statements and rewrite them in your notebook.**

(a) Stem absorbs water and minerals from the soil.

(b) Leaves hold the plant upright.

(c) Roots conduct water to the leaves.

(d) The number of petals and stamens in a flower is always equal.

(e) If the sepals of a flower are joined together, its petals are also joined together.

(f) If the petals of a flower are joined together, then the pistil is joined to the petal.

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content:
2. **Draw**

(a) A leaf

(b) A taproot

(c) A flower you have studied for Table 4.3.

diagrams.reference: Draw (a) a leaf, (b) a taproot and (c) a flower, you have studied for Table 4.3.
diagrams.description: Illustrations of a leaf, taproot, and flower as per Table 4.3.

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 3. Can you find a plant in your house or in your neighborhood, which has a long but weak stem? Write its name. In which category will you place it?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 4. What is the function of a stem?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content:
5. Which of the following leaves have reticulate venation?

Wheat, tulsi, maize, grass, coriander (dhania), China rose

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 6. If a plant has fibrous root, what type of venation do its leaves have?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 7. If a plant has leaves with reticulate venation, what kind of roots will it have?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 8. Is it possible for you to find out whether a plant has taproot or fibrous roots by looking at the impression of its leaf on a sheet of paper?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 9. What are the parts of a flower?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content:
10. From the following plants, which of them have flowers?

Grass, maize, wheat, chilli, tomato, tulsi, peepal, shisham, banyan, mango, jamun, guava, pomegranate, papaya, banana, lemon, sugarcane, potato, groundnut

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 11. Name the part of the plant which produces food. Name the process.

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 12. In which part of a flower, you will find the ovary?

exercises.title: Exercises
exercises.content: 13. Name two plants in which one has joined sepals and the other has separate sepals.
